meanings.definition: A sum of money saved or made available for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The school received a fund to buy new books for the library.
meanings.sent2: She set up a fund to help stray animals in need.
meanings.sent3: The fund for repairing the playground magically doubled overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account was a fund of possibilities for her dream vacation.
meanings.sent5: The emergency fund was a lifesaver during tough times.

meanings.definition: To provide money for (a project or activity) by allocating funds.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to fund the construction of new roads in the city.
meanings.sent2: They fundraised to fund the renovation of the community center.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could fund the moon landing with his loose change.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed funded her through challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The generous donation funded the research for a cure.

meanings.definition: A source or supply of something.
meanings.sent1: The local farm was a fund of fresh produce for the town.
meanings.sent2: Her garden was a fund of colorful flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The treasure chest turned out to be a fund of old pirate coins.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a fund of creative ideas for the project.
meanings.sent5: The library was a fund of knowledge for the curious minds.
